verses.verse: And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> again<WH3254> did<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the LORD<WH3068>, when Ehud<WH164> was dead<WH4191>.

And the LORD<WH3068> sold<WH4376> them into the hand<WH3027> of Jabin<WH2985> king<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667>, that reigned<WH4427> in Hazor<WH2674>; the captain<WH8269> of whose host<WH6635> was Sisera<WH5516>, which dwelt<WH3427> in Harosheth<WH2800> of the Gentiles<WH1471>.

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried<WH6817> unto the LORD<WH3068>: for he had nine<WH8672> hundred<WH3967> chariots<WH7393> of iron<WH1270>; and twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> he mightily<WH2394> oppressed<WH3905> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.
And Deborah<WH1683>, a prophetess<WH5031>, the wife<WH802> of Lapidoth<WH3941>, she judged<WH8199> Israel<WH3478> at that time<WH6256>.

And she dwelt<WH3427> under the palm tree<WH8560> of Deborah<WH1683> between Ramah<WH7414> and Bethel<WH1008> in mount<WH2022> Ephraim<WH669>: and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> came up<WH5927> to her for judgment<WH4941>.

And she sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> Barak<WH1301> the son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42> out of Kedeshnaphtali<WH6943>, and said<WH559> unto him, Hath not the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> commanded<WH6680>, saying, Go<WH3212> and draw<WH4900> toward mount<WH2022> Tabor<WH8396>, and take<WH3947> with thee ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> men<WH376> of the children<WH1121> of Naphtali<WH5321> and of the children<WH1121> of Zebulun<WH2074>?

And I will draw<WH4900> unto thee to the river<WH5158> Kishon<WH7028> Sisera<WH5516>, the captain<WH8269> of Jabin's<WH2985> army<WH6635>, with his chariots<WH7393> and his multitude<WH1995>; and I will deliver<WH5414> him into thine hand<WH3027>.
And Barak<WH1301> said<WH559> unto her, If thou wilt go<WH3212> with me, then I will go<WH1980>: but if thou wilt not go<WH3212> with me, then I will not go<WH3212>.

And she said<WH559>, I will surely<WH1980> go<WH3212> with thee: notwithstanding<WH657> the journey<WH1870> that thou takest<WH1980> shall not be for thine honour<WH8597>; for the LORD<WH3068> shall sell<WH4376> Sisera<WH5516> into the hand<WH3027> of a woman<WH802>. And Deborah<WH1683> arose<WH6965>, and went<WH3212> with Barak<WH1301> to Kedesh<WH6943>.

And Barak<WH1301> called<WH2199> Zebulun<WH2074> and Naphtali<WH5321> to Kedesh<WH6943>; and he went up<WH5927> with ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> men<WH376> at his feet<WH7272>: and Deborah<WH1683> went up<WH5927> with him.

Now Heber<WH2268> the Kenite<WH7017>, which was of the children<WH1121> of Hobab<WH2246> the father in law<WH2859> of Moses<WH4872>, had severed<WH6504> himself from the Kenites<WH7017>, and pitched<WH5186> his tent<WH168> unto the plain<WH436> of Zaanaim<WH6815>, which is by Kedesh<WH6943>.
And they shewed<WH5046> Sisera<WH5516> that Barak<WH1301> the son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42> was gone up<WH5927> to mount<WH2022> Tabor<WH8396>.

And Sisera<WH5516> gathered together<WH2199> all his chariots<WH7393>, even nine<WH8672> hundred<WH3967> chariots<WH7393> of iron<WH1270>, and all the people<WH5971> that were with him, from Harosheth<WH2800> of the Gentiles<WH1471> unto the river<WH5158> of Kishon<WH7028>. together: Heb. by cry, or, proclamation

And Deborah<WH1683> said<WH559> unto Barak<WH1301>, Up<WH6965>; for this is the day<WH3117> in which the LORD<WH3068> hath delivered<WH5414> Sisera<WH5516> into thine hand<WH3027>: is not the LORD<WH3068> gone out<WH3318> before<WH6440> thee? So Barak<WH1301> went down<WH3381> from mount<WH2022> Tabor<WH8396>, and ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> men<WH376> after<WH310> him.

And the LORD<WH3068> discomfited<WH2000> Sisera<WH5516>, and all his chariots<WH7393>, and all his host<WH4264>, with the edge<WH6310> of the sword<WH2719> before<WH6440> Barak<WH1301>; so that Sisera<WH5516> lighted down<WH3381> off his chariot<WH4818>, and fled away<WH5127> on his feet<WH7272>.

But Barak<WH1301> pursued<WH7291> after<WH310> the chariots<WH7393>, and after the host<WH4264>, unto Harosheth<WH2800> of the Gentiles<WH1471>: and all the host<WH4264> of Sisera<WH5516> fell<WH5307> upon the edge<WH6310> of the sword<WH2719>; and there was not a man<WH259> left<WH7604>. a man: Heb. unto one

Howbeit Sisera<WH5516> fled away<WH5127> on his feet<WH7272> to the tent<WH168> of Jael<WH3278> the wife<WH802> of Heber<WH2268> the Kenite<WH7017>: for there was peace<WH7965> between Jabin<WH2985> the king<WH4428> of Hazor<WH2674> and the house<WH1004> of Heber<WH2268> the Kenite<WH7017>.

And Jael<WH3278> went out<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> Sisera<WH5516>, and said<WH559> unto him, Turn in<WH5493>, my lord<WH113>, turn in<WH5493> to me; fear<WH3372> not. And when he had turned in<WH5493> unto her into the tent<WH168>, she covered<WH3680> him with a mantle<WH8063>. mantle: or, rug, or, blanket

And he said<WH559> unto her, Give me, I pray thee, a little<WH4592> water<WH4325> to drink<WH8248>; for I am thirsty<WH6770>. And she opened<WH6605> a bottle<WH4997> of milk<WH2461>, and gave him drink<WH8248>, and covered<WH3680> him.

Again he said<WH559> unto her, Stand in<WH5975> the door<WH6607> of the tent<WH168>, and it shall be, when any man<WH376> doth come<WH935> and enquire<WH7592> of thee, and say<WH559>, Is there<WH3426> any man<WH376> here<WH3426>? that thou shalt say<WH559>, No.

Then Jael<WH3278> Heber's<WH2268> wife<WH802> took<WH3947> a nail<WH3489> of the tent<WH168>, and took<WH7760> an hammer<WH4718> in her hand<WH3027>, and went<WH935> softly<WH3814> unto him, and smote<WH8628> the nail<WH3489> into his temples<WH7541>, and fastened<WH6795> it into the ground<WH776>: for he was fast asleep<WH7290> and weary<WH5774>. So he died<WH4191>. and took: Heb. and put

And, behold, as Barak<WH1301> pursued<WH7291> Sisera<WH5516>, Jael<WH3278> came out<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> him, and said<WH559> unto him, Come<WH3212>, and I will shew<WH7200> thee the man<WH376> whom thou seekest<WH1245>. And when he came<WH935> into her tent, behold, Sisera<WH5516> lay<WH5307> dead<WH4191>, and the nail<WH3489> was in his temples<WH7541>.
So God<WH430> subdued<WH3665> on that day<WH3117> Jabin<WH2985> the king<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667> before<WH6440> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.

And the hand<WH3027> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> prospered<WH3212> <WH1980>, and prevailed<WH7186> against Jabin<WH2985> the king<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667>, until they had destroyed<WH3772> Jabin<WH2985> king<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667>. prospered: Heb. going went and was hard
